item.title: Court denies Apple’s request to pause ruling on App Store payment fees
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: A U.S. court denied Apple a stay on a ruling that requires the company to stop charging developers for payments made outside the App Store through links in apps.

item.title: Cursor’s Anysphere nabs $9.9B valuation, soars past $500M ARR
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The massive round is Anysphere's third fundraise in less than a year. The 3-year-old startup secured its previous capital haul of $100 million at a pre-money valuation of $2.5 billion late last year.

item.title: Circle IPO soars, giving hope to more startups waiting to go public
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The USDC stablecoin issuer ended its first trading day at a 167% jump from its $31 IPO price.

item.title: Why are Elon Musk and Donald Trump fighting?
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Elon Musk donated $288 million to Trump's 2024 election campaign, but now the tech mogul is calling for Trump's impeachment.

item.title: Europe will have to be more Tenacious to land its first rover on the moon
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Tenacious was set to become the first European-made rover to land on the Moon, but communications were lost with the lander that carried it.

item.title: Elon Musk and Donald Trump are smack-talking each other into their own digital echo chambers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Elon Musk and Donald Trump are smack-talking each other into their own echo chambers.

item.title: Perplexity received 780 million queries last month, CEO says
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Srinivas went on to note that the same growth trajectory is possible, especially with the new Comet browser that it's working on.

item.title: Walmart and Wing expand drone delivery to five more US cities
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Walmart and Wing are expanding their partnership and rolling out drone delivery to dozens of more stores in Atlanta, Charlotte, Houston, Orlando, and Tampa.

item.title: Amazon launches new R&D group focused on agentic AI and robotics
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Amazon wants this group to develop an agentic AI framework to be used to give its warehouse robots more skills.

item.title: Rippling calls Deel ‘a criminal syndicate’ and claims 4 other competitors were spied on, too
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The fight between HR tech startups has heated up again after Rippling filed an amended complaint accuses Deel of targeting, infiltrating, and compromising of four other competitors, in addition to Rippling.

item.title: Anthropic co-founder on cutting access to Windsurf: ‘It would be odd for us to sell Claude to OpenAI’
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Anthropic's Jared Kaplan said the company largely cut Windsurf's direct access to Anthropic's Claude AI models because of rumors OpenAI is acquiring the startup.

item.title: Bonfire’s new software lets users build their own social communities, free from platform control
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Bonfire's mission is to build social software where people get to make the decisions, not big tech platform makers like Meta or Google.

item.title: X tests highlighting posts that are liked by users with opposing views
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: X says that this feedback will help develop an open source algorithm that can identify posts liked by people with different perspectives.

item.title: Google says its updated Gemini 2.5 Pro AI model is better at coding
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description: Google says the update to its Gemini 2.5 Pro preview model is better at certain programming tasks and builds on the upgrade to Gemini 2.5 Pro the company announced around a month ago.

item.title: Apple says 82% of compatible iPhones are running iOS 18
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Apple said on Thursday that more than 82% of compatible iPhones are running the latest version of its smartphone operating system, iOS 18.

item.title: Anduril raises $2.5B at $30.5B valuation led by Founders Fund
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Defense tech startup Anduril raised $2.5 billion in a round that included a $1 billion investment from lead backer Founders Fund.

item.title: Snapchat launches an Apple Watch app globally
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: While you could already preview Snapchat messages on your Apple Watch by enabling them on your iPhone, there wasn't a way to respond to them until now.

item.title: Introducing Bounce, a tool to move your following between Bluesky and Mastodon
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The overall goal at A New Social is to shift the power of social networks back to the people, not the platform makers, by giving them tools that let them move their account, their followings, and leave if a platform ever fails them in some way.

item.title: How to watch Apple’s WWDC 2025 keynote
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Apple is expected to unveil changes to its operating systems iOS, iPadOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS, and visionOS at its Worldwide Developers Conference.

item.title: WWDC 2025: What to expect from this year’s conference
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal, Sarah Perez
item.description: WWDC 2025, Apple’s annual developers conference, starts at 10 a.m. PT / 1 p.m. ET. Monday. Last year’s event was notable for its focus on AI, and this year, there is considerable pressure on the company to build on its promises. As in previous years, the company will focus on software updates and new technologies, […]
